messages.subject: Re: ADD/messy houses
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ha, had to do something to lighten things up a bit... but no, really, they do have that effect on him! Michelle H
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., Shelly G <shellyrae00@y...> wrote:
> I did not, however, know that Krispy Kremes made
> diabetics sweaty :) I appreciated the analogy, it just
> made me chuckle a little bit, the image of someone
> scarfing donuts and sweating.
>
>
Ha, had to do something to lighten things up a bit... but no, really,
they do have that effect on him!

Michelle H

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] ADD/messy houses

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/30/02 10:41:13 AM Central Daylight Time,
shellyrae00@... writes:


> Thanks also for the link to systems goddess. By the
> way, I have a fancy planner, too. It makes a great
> coaster for my coffee cup :)
>
> Shelly

This must be why unschooling works for so many of us! Our fancy planners are
coasters and our beautiful desktop calendars are *doodle pads!
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] ADD/messy houses
messages.msgSnippet: Michelle: Thanks for your additional thoughts on ADD. I, like you, don t deny its existence ... just would rather accentuate the positives of ADD traits rather
messages.messageBody:
Michelle:

Thanks for your additional thoughts on ADD. I, like
you, don't deny its existence ... just would rather
accentuate the positives of ADD traits rather than the
limitations. Sounds like your family does much the
same thing.

I did not, however, know that Krispy Kremes made
diabetics sweaty :) I appreciated the analogy, it just
made me chuckle a little bit, the image of someone
scarfing donuts and sweating.

Thanks also for the link to systems goddess. By the
way, I have a fancy planner, too. It makes a great
coaster for my coffee cup :)

Shelly
